page.title: 02Risby Poor's Heath 1
page.content: Quite a large proportion of this block is covered by this Heath. Heathland it is no longer.During the 39-45 war the subsidy paid by the Ministry of Agriculture made it eminently worthwhile to plough up hitherto worthless heathland that had long been considered unworthy of intensive agriculture. People of the village remember playing at weekends or in the evenings on the Heath in prewar days. It was poor soil at the surface levels and was covered by gorse,broom and brambles. Rabbits abounded and actually catching them on the Heath used to form part of a regular diet,not only to supplement wartime rations but also to help out with meagre wage packets.
